DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity Range ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): (1) randomization, direct assignment based on eligibility criteria, etc. (2) "Escalating dose cohort studies" enroll subjects in successive arms, i.e., one arm is completely filled before any subjects are enrolled in the next arm. In such a study, allocation depends on which arms have been fully enrolled and which are currently open for enrollment. Note that this example assumes that the experimental unit is the subject (rather than a part of a subject or a group of subjects). An integer falling within minimum and maximum bounds that specifies how many times the activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days = 10 repeats.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains URG so that the values are non-negative integers.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
